verses.text: ，兩情相悅你這女子中極美麗的啊！你的良人到哪裡去了？你的良人轉到哪裡去了？讓我們與你去尋找他吧！

words.note: Literary; often refers to mutual affection.
Refers to a young woman or lady, often respectfully.
Literary term for a beloved person, spouse, or good man.
More formal/literary than '和'.

verses.heading: \bd \+it \+w The Maidens to the Beloved:|strong="H0575"\+w*\+it*\bd*

verses.text: 我的良人下到自己的園中，下到香花畦那裡，在園內細賞，採摘百合花。

words.note: More formal/literary than '欣賞'.

verses.heading: \bd \+it \+w The Beloved|strong="H1730"\+w* \+w to the Maidens:|strong="H3381"\+w*\+it*\bd*

verses.text: 我屬我的良人，我的良人也屬我；他在百合花中細賞。
verses.heading: \bd \+it \+w The Beloved about Her Lover:|strong="H0589"\+w*\+it*\bd*

verses.text: 我的佳偶啊！你美麗如得撒，秀麗如耶路撒冷，威武如展開旗幟的軍隊。

words.note: Literary term for a good or beautiful spouse/partner.
Describes a delicate, refined beauty.

verses.heading: \bd \+it \+w The Lover to His Beloved:|strong="H7474"\+w*\+it*\bd*

verses.text: 請你轉眼不要看我，因為你的眼使我心動！你的頭髮如同從基列山下來的山羊群。
你的牙齒像一群母羊，剛剛洗淨上來那樣潔白整齊；牠們成雙成對，沒有單獨一隻的。

words.note: Reduplication of 剛 (gāng, just).
An idiom describing things in matched pairs.
Here, it turns 'single one' into 'a single one'.

verses.text: 你的兩頰在面紗後面，如同切開的石榴。
雖有六十位王后，八十位妃嬪，並有無數的宮女；

words.note: Historical term for secondary consorts.
Refers to female servants in a palace.

verses.text: 唯獨我的鴿子，我的完全人，是獨一的；是她母親獨一的寶貝，是生養她者的寵兒。眾女子看見她，都稱她為有福；王后妃嬪見了，也都讚賞她，說：

words.note: Often used symbolically in biblical contexts.
Refers to one who is morally or spiritually complete.

words.definition: to give birth to and raise

words.note: A classical nominalizer, forming 'the one who...'
Often used in formal or literary contexts.
Historical term for secondary consorts.

verses.text: 「那出現如破曉的晨光，美麗如月亮，燦爛如日頭，威武有如展開旗幟的軍隊的是誰呢？」

words.note: Refers to the breaking of dawn.
A more traditional or poetic term for sun than 太陽.

verses.text: 我下到核桃園去，看看谷中青綠的植物，看看葡萄樹發芽沒有，石榴樹開花沒有；

words.note: Reduplication indicates a casual or brief action.
Reduplication indicates a casual or brief action.
Used at the end of a sentence to form a yes/no question.
Used at the end of a sentence to form a yes/no question.

verses.heading: \bd \+it \+w The Lover to His Beloved:|strong="H3381"\+w*\+it*\bd*

verses.text: 不知不覺之間，我的心把我置於我尊貴的民的車中。

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb, indicating it is acted upon.
Formal usage, often found in classical or literary contexts.
Refers to high status or honor.
Often refers to an ancient chariot in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 回來吧，回來吧，書拉密女啊！回來吧，回來吧，讓我們看看你。你們為甚麼要看書拉密女，像看兩隊兵跳舞呢？

words.note: Indicates a suggestion, command, or request.
Indicates a suggestion, command, or request.
Refers to the female protagonist in Song of Songs.
Used at the end of a sentence to express exclamation or surprise.
Indicates a suggestion, command, or request.
Indicates a suggestion, command, or request.
Reduplication indicates a casual or brief action.
Refers to the female protagonist in Song of Songs.
Measure word for groups of people or animals.
Used at the end of a question to soften the tone or seek further information.
Specific term for 'this verse' in textual references.
A collection of ancient Jewish texts of the Hebrew Bible.

verses.heading: \bd \+it \+w The|strong="H3045"\+w* Lover \+w to|strong="H5315"\+w* \+w His|strong="H7760"\+w* Beloved:\+it*\bd*
